result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Adam Bradley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:16 AM. Also called 15CF135, 15CF80, 15CF56, and 15CF65. State - here for sentencing on all matters - have complied with victim notification requirements on all files and one restitution request and no VIS provided. Cveykus - 14CF153 - previously plead to counts #2 and #3; 15CF65 - previously plead to #1 and #4; 15CF80 - previously plead to counts #1 and #3; will be pleading today to remaining cases. State - PSI was ordered in previously plead cases. Cveykus - 15CF156 - plead to count #1 deleting the repeater, #2 - deleting the repeater, #3 - deleting the repeater, DRI counts #4, #5, #6, #7, #8 and #9; 15CF135 - plead to count #1 deleting repeater, #2 - plead to and delete repeater, #4 - plead to and deleting repeater, #6 - plead to and deleting repeater, DRI counts #3, #5, #7, #8, #9 and #10; 9 year prison sentence with 4 in and 5 out. Cveykus - 14CF153 - count #2 - 30 days in jail, #3 - 2 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 1 year of ES - concurrent to count #2; 15CF65 - count #1 - 9 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 4 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES; count #4 - 9 months county jail - concurrent; 15CF135 - count #1 - 3.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES, count #2 - 3.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES, count #4 - 9 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 4 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES, #6 - 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES, 15CF80 - count #1 - 3.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES, #3 - 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES,, 15CF56 - count #1 - 9 months county jail, #2 - 9 months county jail, count #3 - 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES, - all concurrent with each other, 83 days credit. Discussion on credit. Cveykus would prefer that the JOC not reflect any credit at this time and it will be handled thru stip and order. State agrees. Sate - restitution in case #15CF56 of $2800.00 plus VW surcharge to victim (LL). Bradley agrees with recommendation as stated. Court - 15CF56 - amends #1 to delete repeater allegations, pleads G as amended; count #2 - amend to delete repeater allegations - pleads G as amended, #3 - amend to delete repeater allegation, pleads G as amended; 15CF135 - count #1, #2, #4 and #6 - amend all to delete repeater allegations, Bradley pleads G to counts #1, #2, #4 and #6 as amended, court DRI counts  #3, #5, #7, #8, #9 and #10, on 15CF56, Court DRI counts #4, #5, #6, #7, #8 and #9. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State and Cveykus have PSI, no errors noticed by Cveykus, court will not consider any part of the PSI that dealt with the Compass Evaluation. State agrees and has no objections. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - State asking that if the Court orders the defendant eligible for programs that it not begin until after half of his sentence is served but prefers the defendant not be eligible for those programs for stated reasons. Cveykus makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks court to make him eligible for programs after serving the first year in prison. Bradley makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CF80 - #1 - 3.5 in prison with 1.5 in and 2 out, #3 - 6 in prison with 3 in and 3 out; 15CF56 - #1 - 9 months in county jail, #2 - 9 months in county jail, #3 - 6 years in prison with 3 in and 3 out, restitution of $2800.00 plus VW surcharge - take bond posted - remainder to be paid witin 90 days of incarceration; 15CF135 - #1 - 3.5 years in prison with 1.5 in and 2 out, #2 - 3.5 years in prison with 1.5 in and 2 out, #4 - 9 years in prison with 4 in and 5 out, #6 - 6 years in prison with 3 in and 3 out; 15CF65, #1 - 9 years in prison with 4 in and 5 out, #4 - 9 months in county jail; 14CF153 - #2 - 2 years in prison with 1 in and 1 out, #3 - 30 days in county jail, each count on each case are to be concurrent with each other, each sentence in each case will be concurrent; conditions include: no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, costs on each counts - to be paid within 30 days on ES, obtain GED, employment/school and obtain a job within the first 4 months on ES, eligible for both programs after serving the first 2 years of his sentence, credit to be determined by counsel thru stip and order and to be completed within 2 weeks - otherwise a hearing will be set, submit DNA sample, no possession of firearms, no right to vote, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called 9:47 AM. Called 15CF153, 15CF65, 15CF135, 15CF80, 15CF56. Cveykus - DA  Simono had an agreement previously but there was one issue that wasn't clear, possibly restitution, court will adjourn all cases to allow parties to resolve.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:08 PM. Also called 15CF80 and 15CF65. State - here on bail bond hearings due to non-appearance. Ferguson, believes we need to quash the warrant on all these cases, and set bond on all these matters and set all matters for sentencing hearing as plea has already been given. State - bond - asks for remand and no bond. Ferguson objects - being held on a probation hold and $5000.00 cash bond on new charges, asking for modest cash bond on each of these case and set these matters for sentencing hearing. State - PSI has been filed and parties are free to argue. Court remands the defendant without bond and sets for sentencing hearing on all these matters. Ferguson - bond forfeiture on this case and 15CF80 - asks not to forfeit bond and hold them to pay the fines, fees, etc. Court confirms bond forfeiture, court will forfeit bond on these two cases (15CF65 and 15cf80).  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's response to  demand for discovery

Attorney Gary S. Cirilli in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:13 PM. Also called 15CF80, 15CF65 and 14CF153. Cirilli represents the defendant on 15CF56 and Amy Ferguson represents the defendant on the other matters. Cirilli asks for adjournment as does Ferguson. State requests forfeiture of any bond posted and asks for bench warrant. Cirilli objects to bond forfeiture as does Ferguson. Court forfeits any bond posted, issues bench warrant, body only on all cases.

Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:24 PM. State - believes PH is being waived and has filed Information that mirrors complaint in anticipation of that. Cirilli and Bradley agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Cirilli has Information and will proceed to ARGN, waives reading of Information, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for FPT - the date and time is backing up a JT. Cirilli - would like the no contact provision lifted for stated reasons. Court - victim needs to follow proper procedure to get the no-contact provision lifted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in custody and appears via video from FOSO, with attorney Gary S. Cirilli appearing in person. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:42 AM. Bradley and Cirilli have the complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH but will waive the time limits. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond and sets for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:03 PM. Also called 15CF80 and 15CF65. State - here for AIA on 15CF56 and PH's on 15CF80 and 15CF65. Ferguson informs Court that she does not represent the defendant on 15CF56 due to conflict but does represent the defendant on the other matters. Ferguson - willing to proceed with waiver of PH today and to ARGN and provides court with waiver of PH form. Bradley agrees. State files Informations for both cases that both mirror the complaints. Ferguson has Information, waives reading of them, proceed to ARGN and pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts pleas on both those cases, continues bond on both of those cases and sets both of those case for FPT. Defendant is currently on a P&P hold until 7/31/15. Court sets these two matters (15CF80 and 15CF65) for FPT on 8/5/15 at 3:00 PM. Court continues bond on 15CF56 and sets for AIA, inform Cirilli.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in court, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:24 AM. Defendant does not have an attorney on this matter yet. Bradley does not have complaint. State - returned in the mail - will send with Deputy Thornton. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Bradley wishes to have an attorney, will be able to retain one by next week, can afford to hire his own. Court sets this matter for AIA on 7/8/15 at 3:00 PM.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol and no contact with Leah Larock.

Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson who appears telephonically.  Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:56 AM. Ferguson states that she is representing the defendant on other matters as she has a conflict but appears today specially just to address the setting of bond. Court reviews minutes. Court reads charges and penalties. Ferguson released from case and hangs up (10:59 AM). Court reads charges and penalties and rights to attorney. Bradley understands charges and penalties and will be hiring his own attorney. Court sets for AIA. State - bond - $1500 cash for stated reasons. Court - bond - $1500.00 cash, no consumption of alcohol, no contact with Leah Larock.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Called 10:16 am. State by JBC. No appearance by defendant. Attorney Cirilli indicates that he was suppose to be retained today as he spoke to defendant however can not contact him this morning. Cirilli not retained at this time. State asks for warrant. Court forfeit any bond and b/w body/$500. Adj.
